snippet: The nannies, cooks, baby sitters and others have long been excluded from fundamental protections other workers enjoy. California should close that gap.
abstract: Editorial supports bill being considered by the California Legislature that would extend basic labor rights to domestic workers; expresses hope that California and other states will be willing to do what the federal government has not--set standards to guarantee nannies, cooks, baby sitters and other caregivers decent working conditions and pay.
lead_paragraph: The nannies, cooks, baby sitters and others have long been excluded from fundamental protections other workers enjoy. California should close that gap.

headline.seo: Rights for Domestic Workers in California
